Reviews.Title: “Great localization”
Reviews.Author: Luda74
Reviews.Content: Great localization and good service, few steps from Via del Corso. It is small and charming. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast was good. Small, but clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: LemboAntonio
Reviews.Content: Very good and confortable hotel, the location is perfect, and also the breakfast is very italian, the staff i very kindly

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: MonkeymanMalta
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for 4 days at the end of March and stayed at the Hotel Forte. I have to say that this is an excellent hotel, small and intimate.It is beautifully furnished throughout, the reception staff are courteoous and very helpful and all spoke English. Breakfast was good and set us up for the day ahead. On return to our room on my birthday there was a lovely bottle of chianti waiting for us, and a tray with 2 glasses and some sweets. it is ideally situated in a lovely and quiet small street just off the main shoppping area. It is less than 5 minutes away from the Spanish Steps and Spagna Metro station, and only a few more minutes to the Trevi Fountain. It was such an enjoyable stay that we have already booked to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ork51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Forte for 5 nights in March, the hotel is in a great location only minutes from the Spanish Steps but in a lovely quite street. The staff were lovely friendly and helpful,breakfast was also good a selection of bread for toasting,pastries,fruit,eggs,ham and a small cooked selection,my only slight criticism would be the processed cheese such a shame when Italy has such lovely cheeses.We were in room 140 and it was very clean quite and with a good en-suite. Will use the hotel Forte when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 45Scotland
Reviews.Content: stayed for long weekend with group of friends - fantastic location - could walk to various sites and several good restaurants. very friendly staff who were on hand with help 24/7. comfortable bed and nice,very clean bathrooms - rooms been decorated since our last visit. 138 was good, plenty room, no view - but dont need one!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lynne E
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent location - off the main road and very quiet. Literally minutes from the Spanish Steps, Via del Corso and Via dei Condotti. We had the 1st room just off reception, had no view and did have some early morning noise, but nothing major. We spent very little time in the hotel other than breakfast and sleeping but it was very clean and the staff were friendly. Breakfast was ok - very small area but fine, self serve- plenty of tea and coffee, scrambled eggs (never hot), frankfurters, bacon (I think!), pastries, cakes, yogurts and toast - it was more than adequate. En-suite was good, with great shower, hairdryer and shampoo sachets. Able to leave suitcases but only in reception - didnt feel unsafe though. The only downfall to our trip were the prices (paid 30 euros for 2 paninis and small beers in a not so good cafe) - it is very expensive at the moment, particularly for food and drink - a beer ranged from 6 euros (for a very small one) to 11 euros for a litre!!! Wine started at around 8 euros for a glass. Pastas and pizzas range from around 8 euros upwards, and meat dishes start from around 15 euros. Found a great sandwich bar on the main road just outside the hotel called IL Baretto (used by locals) - 2 excellent paninis for less than 5 euros. Also a supermarket (quite hidden) one of the side streets opposite the hotel for water (0.35 euros instead of 3 euros!), etc. Restaurants and and cafe's really do charge extortionate prices at the moment. Flew with Ryan Air and would definitely recommend the bus from the airport to Rome city (4 euros per person each way - excellent value). Be careful at the Vatican - it's not clear what you are queuing for - there is a main queue to get through security, but then it is free to enter the Basillica. If you want to climb to the top of the dome there is an extra charge (there are 330 steps (approx) to get to the 1st level in a very small winding staircase (with no turning back!), then a lift to the very top - but a brilliant view). To see the Sistene Chapel, you have to leave the main Vatican area and walk around the outside, then pay to go through the Vatican museum (amazing) - the Sistene Chapel is one of the very last rooms, but well worth it. Try emailing the hotels directly or looking online for the best price. DO NOT get caught out by the "gladiators offering photographs" at the Colloseum - they will charge you around 30 euros to be photographed with them, but there is no indication of this initially. Also wouldn't recommend paying extra for the video aid (mainly old1950's clips of old gladiator movies!)-not sure how different the audio was-if you want this, you can also buy your entry ticket at this desk and avoid queuing twice . Overall we had a brilliant time, fantastic city, weather was brilliant, hotel was great - only thing spoiling was the cost of sitting in fantastically located cafes and restaurants. But, would definitely do it again :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: Danny K
Reviews.Content: This Hotel's location is supreme, all the major sites are in a walking distance. The Hotel itself is clean and welcoming, rooms are a bit small (especially Room 146 - was our room for the 1st night due to some double booking issue) but furnished well and offer a pleasant stay. Street facing rooms (like ours - 124) may be a bit noisy during the morning hours, but it didn't bother us much (and I'm a light sleeper...). We recommend this hotel for anyone touring Rome, it provides a great location, nice breakfast, clean and comfortable rooms and welcoming staff. Prices are high, but so are all the Hotels in the Center. Overall - was an excellent choice for us !

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: o_eliav
Reviews.Content: very good location, central but quiet. smiling and helpful staff. small but clean and well maintained rooms. generous breakfast. reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: HansK40
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forte is a small historic hotel near the Spanish stairs and the old city center. In walking distance to almost everything. Clean and with good wifi in the rooms. Small bathrooms but clean. If you travel by car the nearest parking house is Villa Borghese with walking entrance from the metro station Spanish stairs. Good value for money to be in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “a memorable stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: monica v
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forte We would definately recommed this hotel not only for its excellent location ,especially for those who love historical cities, but also for the friendliness and courtesy of the staff, who made our 5 day stay in Rome a memorable and wonderful experience . We look foward to repeat our stay at this hotel in the near future. GRAZIE ROMA SEI FORTE. Michael & Monica from MALTA E.U.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Christophe K
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good place, the staff is very nice. Bad point : Too much noises in the hotel (others rooms, guests, ...) at night.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you really really have to!”
Reviews.Author: ilkim
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at this hotel as Hotel Manfredi was full for our last night. It was a big mistake. Please see separate review for Hotel Manfredi which is in the same building. Hotel Forte was so much below our expectations. The only good thing is obviously the location. There was not even a room to leave our luggage. They just left them on the corridor. We did not even consider having breakfast at the hotel, therefore I cannot comment on the breakfast. The room was a standard room but it was very tiny even for Rome standards. There was no place to put our luggage. We were too tired to look for another hotel, but I really wish that we did!

Reviews.Title: “Three berlin people in rome”
Reviews.Author: steven_kontakt
Reviews.Content: We were with our daughter in Rome and had a triple room booked at the Hotel Forte for 5 days. This was an excellent choice. The room was adequate on the size, very clean and the bathroom even had a bathtub. The breakfast buffet was delicious. Located near the Spanish Steps, are also within reach of many attractions on foot. As the hotel is located in a side street, it is far from the Roman road. Only from 7:30 am it is loud for half an hour when school starts. If we at some point again in Rome, Hotel Forte will again be first choice.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: helswind
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the city centre - basically close to everything. Good breakfast for Italy, very helpful staff which is speaking several languages, clean rooms - we stayed in a standard double room and it was perfect for the 2 of us, very clean! Bathroom was very clean, too. All in All a very good *** hotel ! I would definitley book it again. Rome is a stunning city, you find yourself in the middle of historical sites everywhere. Very fascinating!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: debgeorge8
Reviews.Content: A rather late review as our stay was early September 2011. We found this hotel to be in a quiet location but still close to everything. We loved the choices at breakfast as a cooked breakfast is not always available in Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room clean and a good size for 2 as we were not there to stay in our room all day!!! The bottle of Chianti in our room was delicious and a nice welcoming touch. Would recommend a visit to this quaint hotel near the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Janice Cape Town”
Reviews.Author: Janice W
Reviews.Content: Located in a beautiful old and historic area. Close to most places we wanted to walk to. The atmosphere around the Spanish steps over Christmas was wonderful. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The bedroom and shower were a bit small but very clean and comfortable. I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I spent four nights here and found it to be an excellent Hotel in an excellent location. It is off the main drag and housed in a beautiful old building. Staff were excellent and always polite and knowledgeable. Only drawback for us (or me) was that we stayed in a room close to the reception/breakfast area and could hear the breakfast being set up very early every morning, not the best location for a light sleeper. This would not stop us staying here again though and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: paul c
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Forte. personnel is classy: Maurizio, Fabio, Jennifer...

Reviews.Title: “A charming acquaintance”
Reviews.Author: hansas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Hotel Forte in the beginning of November. Situated in an old building in a quiet narrow street in Rome - it placed us close to almost everything. The Spanish Steps around the corner, and most other major sights within easy walking distance. The room was quite small, but quite comfortable. The shower might prove daunting if you are anything above XL. Service at the Front Desk excellent - and in very good english! A surprisingly good breakfast buffet was included in our rate. We will in all probability be back...

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anastasia_033
Reviews.Content: a wonderful hotel,just in the center of rome!i have been 3 times in rome,the last 2 i stayed in this hotel and if i'll go back i will prefer it too!so lovely hotel,clean,really friendly staff,delicious breakfast and only 2 minutes walk from piazza di spanga,but also in a quite street!excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SOFYA S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forte has excellent location to the famous places of Rome.Very friendly staff, very clean and comfortable rooms. It is quite in the room. The breakfast was very delicious - hot scrambled eggs with bacon and sausages, fruits, yogurt, breads, croissants, cakes, jam. If we arrive Rome again, we stay at Hotel Forte!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Felicity M
Reviews.Content: We rented a room for 3 people and all of us agreed that this was a wonderful place! The hotel's location is just blocks away from the Spagna metro stop and subsequently the Spanish Steps. It's on a quiet side street and is well labeled with red flags. The only trick is that the hotel is on the second floor of the building; you may need to use the intercom to get into the building. There is a small elevator if you have luggage. The room was clean and small; it had everything we needed and fit our luggage. Plus there was a small safe which was easy to use. The beds were comfortable and the window shutters created a black-out effect in the room and provided us with a great night of sleep. The bathroom was large and the water pressure and temperature were excellent. The breakfast was good and had a nice variety of options, with hot and cold food and beverage choices. The staff was really friendly and helpful. For the price, you can't beat it! While we were only there one night due to our vacation itinerary, we really enjoyed our stay and would gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StacyJane
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Rome, staying in the Hotel Forte. We arrived before our check in time but found that our room was ready for us anyway. We ordered a double room which was small but had ample room for a couple. The bed was comfortable, ample space in the wardrobe and the bathroom was big with a wonderful hot and powerful shower. We had the added bonus of the mini bar and found the drinks we had were not expensive at all. We used the TV for the news channel only but you could use it with the keyboard as a computer at an extra charge if you wanted. The breakfast room was nice with cereals, breads, croissants, cakes, fruit (both fresh and tinned), scrambled eggs and sausage were also on offer as a hot alternative. Tea and Coffee were served also. All staff at the Hotel Forte were very friendly and helpful. Upon arrival we were given a map with all areas of interest circled for us and we spoke about where we wanted to see. We walked everywhere - to the Vatican also it is only 25 minutes away on foot. We found the area beautiful and enchanting and would definately visit again staying at the Hotel Forte! We read mixed reviews on this hotel but we had no problems at all not with noise or anything..Superb Thank you

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem.................”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideEyes
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at Hotel Forte. Location of this hotel was great close to most attractions and shopping in Rome..........The staff were most helpful and friendly especially Fabio...............Our room was small but spotless, comfortable and quiet....Good breakfast selection with excellent coffee..............We had been travelling through Italy for 2 weeks and found this hotel to be a real little gem............Rates change daily but for us it was good value................Grazie................Aussie Travellers............

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: canuckcowboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forte is a gem in the perfect location on a quaint, quiet street, very close to the Spanish Steps and other attractions which was great for us as we walked every where to enjoy the sights of Rome. The rooms were typical European in size, very clean, lots of hot water for showers, great breakfast selection(s) and super staff who were very friendly and informative. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: tidewaterred
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was okay, and the staff helping serve were very attentive. The location really is perfect and the hotel is very much in line with what I expected from other reviews that I've read and the price/value ratio is good. Wi-fi at 5 euro/day/device is not too bad, but charging for wi-fi is a little past its prime.

Reviews.Title: “At this price, and still €5/day/device for wifi.”
Reviews.Author: Rosselliot
Reviews.Content: Other than the fact that everything is tiny -the bed, the shower, the toilet, the door - and this coming from an American who has lived in Europe for well over 2 years and used to showers being 8-9" too short for my 6'2" frame. The hotel itself is fine - the room is, as mentioned, TINY and the bed even more so, and the location is nothing to put down. But the killer for me is the fact that the wifi is €5 per day per device and they completely relentless about it. I'm staying with two other people - I have a smartphone, an ipad, and my computer, and the other two guests with me each have 2 devices they'd like hooked up to the internet - so this hotel would expect us to pay €35/day to keep our devices connected to the internet?! Last week I stayed at a hostel in Florence (good location, too) for 3 days - €14/night with all the free wifi I could handle. In today's world, charging for wifi is a JOKE...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hartea3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept and really enjoyed our stay. The location is great. I spend hours and hours going through trip advisor trying to find the perfect hotel with regards to price and location etc.. this was it. It was affordable and location second to none. We walked everywhere in Rome. Some really nice restaurants very close by. While the room is on the small side.. its perfect for what you want. When you are in Rome you have so much to do you dont spend long in your room. Breakfast was nice. The only negative was that we had been up from 6am travelling arrived at 12pm and we had to wait 2 hours for check in at 2pm. I think they could have been a littlie more flexible on that. They stored our bags etc.. but I just wanted bed! Apart from that defo recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FM-SG
Reviews.Content: September 2011 was our first trip to Rome. The hotel is well located, you have access to all monuments and wonderful sites, and all of this at walking distance. The street is a quiet street even in situated in the central tourist zone of Rome. The hotel staff are really nice and helpful. The hotel door downstair is close at night and during the day a guard is downstair, this help people feel more secure. The breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stilling56
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated for a visit to Rome,you have easy access to many wonderful sites.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve more than three stars, really”
Reviews.Author: TOURtheWORLDMexPal
Reviews.Content: Reviews of trip advisor were encouraging, therefore we went by them, but we were not happy that much with this hotel especially with the amount we paid (184 EUR per night for small double room) The positive: Most of the hotel staff is nice and helpful The location is very convenient in the Spanish steps area Decent bed mattress Room does not smell bad The negative: Very small room No view and noisy in the morning (room#124) Cannot open window because the smell of cigarette smoke reach the room Toilet flush needs 12 minutes to refill Bathroom towels need to retire, being used and abused, and very rough on the skin No bathroom fan Not enough electrical outlets No internet reception inside the rooms Phone reception is very spotty, you cannot complete a call The breakfast is very basic; prepackaged sliced toast, coffee from small vending machine, canned fruits, low grade meat cuts, sweetened and flavored canned juices…,etc No ice maker machine, and the small one in the kitchen is nonfunctional As a loyal "Trip Advisor" member, I cannot recommend this hotel to my fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “hotel charges”
Reviews.Author: paccardo
Reviews.Content: Hotel did not honor charges that had been agreed via email. Pefect location, but very tiny rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: jeoden
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Hotel Forte last September 2010. We had an excellent experience! We flew into Rome on a different flights, my son's arriving in the morning and mine late in the evening. The gentlemen at Hotel Forte, Maurizo, Fabio and Leonardo could not have taken better care of me. They had a driver waiting for me at the airport with my name on a sign. After 25 long hours of travel it was a site for sore eyes. The location of the Hotel Forte is wonderful. I walked everywhere, frequently alone and was never uncomfortable. Our room was one floor above the reception desk and yes, the room was small but we expected that. After all, we had reserved just the basic double room. It was not a fancy room but it was nicely appointed and very clean. We thought the breakfast was very nice, just enough to get you moving and out the door. The gentlemen at the front desk were always very eager and helpful in giving us directions and restaurant suggestions. I am planning a trip to Rome next summer, this time with my husband, and hope to stay once again at the Hotel Forte.

Reviews.Title: “very good ! recommend 100%”
Reviews.Author: rita n
Reviews.Content: the location was amazing. staff was very kind. breakfast was a normal.

Reviews.Title: “good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: 789anonymous
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel, good breakfast, convenient location near piazza popolo on side street isolated at night so take care

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Elad K
Reviews.Content: we took 4 nights at the hotel. the staff were polite, nice and very welcoming! the location is very good - that's why the hotel is not so chip.... the food in the morning is nice - delicious croissant and coffee the room was clean but very very small - take it into consideration.... very recommanded for those who wish to be close to everywhere...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie631
Reviews.Content: My mother & I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Forte. It's in a fantastic location, just 5 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and has many designer shops like Tiffany and Gucci nearby. We both felt completely safe walking around the area in the evening. Our room was small but very clean and had everything we needed, including a lovely view onto the Via Margutta! The reception staff were all very helpful and the lady who served us at breakfast was lovely! It had a real traditional Italian feel to it rather than just staying in a chain hotel. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & we will definitely return in the future”
Reviews.Author: kopking
Reviews.Content: Just back on Tuesday having stayed in this hotel.As it says it IS RIGHT BESIDE the Spanish Steps. Just a two min walk literally. It is also within walking distance of the Trevi fountain & Via del Condotti.THe directions on its homepage to the hotel are spot on. It is also right on a metro stop. The hotel is very tastefully decorated.The staff on reception have excellent English,they were always very friendly & helpful to us. The breakfast area is small but if you get there before 9.45am you will have no problems. There is an excellent choice on offer for breakfast. We had a triple room & there was plenty of space for the three of us in it. I will definitely stay there again when in Rome & will recommend it to friends & family also. Enjoy if you do go to Hotel Forte.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for a trip to rome”
Reviews.Author: Sofia K
Reviews.Content: You cant beat this hotel for a perfect location to stay while visiting Rome if you intend to walk everywhere. Right in the heart of the city near the spanish steps with convenient access to all the attractions, yet quiet enough to really relax. A fine breakfast, comfortable and immaculately clean rooms and bathrooms and very helpful, polite staff. Just when you dont think it can get any better, the bill is extremely reasonable given the location. Definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Dawn V
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking to all of the various sights around Rome. Bathroom was modern and nice and clean. Smallish type room. Breakfast was basic and marginal at best. It didn't kill us, but not exactly up to par with other places that we stayed in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on artsy Via Margutta”
Reviews.Author: lanago2
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Spanish Steps location. Around the corner from the Steps and Metro stop, "Spagna." Tiny lift but good to have one. I reserved a nice, spacious room, at a special internet rate of 170 euros nightly. We were given the tiny room 116 and wouldn't accept it. When they saw we were willing to leave and find another hotel, wonderful quaint 2 level suite room #144 magically appeared. Loved it. Not for those with mobility issues, but for a mom and college aged daughter, fantastic. They call it a 2 BR but it's really 2 twin beds in the main room then go down a little narrow-stepped staircase to a dressing room, table, TV, armoire, luggage rack, one twin bed tucked into the corner and a bathroom with good soaking tub, toilet, bidet. A little window opened onto a little "courtyard" but really faced another building so it gave some light and air and privacy. Great to have the extra room. It's right around the corner from the buzz and hustle of Spanish Steps, but you walk to this contemporary art-filled oasis of quiet luxury. There are art galleries on Via Margutta and a couple of high end hotels--Hotel Art and 54. In the same building as Forte, on another floor, is the Hotel Manfredi, which is nice also. I stayed there before--it's geared and outfitted more for a business traveler. I wouldn't consider $250 to be a good value in places outside Rome, NYC and a couple of other places, but in this case, I would.

Reviews.Title: “First class - as usual”
Reviews.Author: juliapalmer7
Reviews.Content: Our fourth time for a short break at this hotel. As usual was not disappointed! Very clean and friendly hotel. Sleeping experience was great - black out, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast very good, now bacon and eggs an option along with cereal, fruit, pastries etc. Staff as usual very helpful - and speak good english! Location of this hotel is so convenient and parking very easy at villa borghese. Thoroughly recommend and cannot wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: emo88
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful on most occasions. Location was great if you like the busy atmosphere of the Spanish steps, however beware of the flower wielding gypsy. Breakfast was ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it we will be back”
Reviews.Author: CorkMaryf
Reviews.Content: great location friendly staff very comfortable we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and well located hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Renata035
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Forte (July 29th to August 03rd) was really great. Forte is beautiful and luxurious, much more than one could expect from a 3-stars hotel. The staff is incredibly kind and helpful, specially Jenny, who gave me and my friends a lot of nice information about Rome, even browsing the internet to help us find anything we needed. Breakfast was also great, with a great variety of hot drinks, juice, nice bread, cheese, ham, turkey breast, jelly, wonderful fresh croissants and homemade yogurt. Location is just perfect, since the hotel is a 5 min walk from Piazza di Spagna and Spagna metro station, 10 min walk from Fontana di Trevi and 15-20 min walk from Pantheon and Piazza Navona. I would definitely stay there again and also recommend it to all my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Padame007
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Forte mid July 2011. This hotel is a GEM!!! It is in a fantastic location with lots of restaurants in the local vicinity to choose from. We had a double room. The room was smaller than expected, but in saying that, the room was compac, well appointed and and very comfortable. We had a view to Via Margutta and a very functional and clean bathroom. The staff were more than happy us out with all our queries and requests and we thank you all for your hospitality. I would definitely stay here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist tax? Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Cheap-traveler28
Reviews.Content: Plz read entire review: Service was great.  Hotel maids cleaned our rooms nicely (even when we put do Not disturb signs up).  Front desk clerks were great, especially the younger gentlemen.   This hotel has a great location about 1/4 mile from the Spanish steps, great shopping area, and Spagna metro stop (great considering we came in on the train with luggage).  It was also an easy walk to the Trevi fountain and Imperial palace/memorial.  We also walked to the Forum and Coliseum but were fatigued at the end of the day.  There are many taxis close to the Spanish steps if you don't want to walk. Cons: we asked our hotel to book reservations for the Vatican (4 euro) but they booked us for a private tour company instead (60 euro).  We weren't do upset because the tour was good, we skipped the 2-hour line, and a driver picked us up in the morning while a bus returned us to the hotel. We then asked them to call a taxi to take us to the airport when leaving.  Instead, we got a private driver in a Mercedes for 50 euro.  It is law for a taxi in Rome to not charge higher than 45 euro from airport to downtown.  Of course the private driver is exempt so we paid the extra 5 euro. He was excellent so we didn't complain.  Even after we got to the airport and he told us that he couldn't take credit cards (my hotel assured us that he did).  He was very nice, even took the residual we owed him in US dollars.   Shady business: when checking out, our hotel allowed us to pay the room rate with our credit card.  However, we when then told there was a "tourist tax" that could not be paid with credit card, cash only.  We had stayed in 5 different hotels all over Italy on our trip and had never come across this. Maybe this is legitimate, or maybe it was the hotels way to scam tourist.  I am on the plane while writing this and haven't had a chance to research the matter.   Summary: great location, great service, good air-conditioned rooms, good complimentary breakfast.  Bad things= Internet  cost 5 euros for 24hrs and strange tourist tax at checkout, maids ignored door sign (like all other hotels in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdwardPRZ
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel and the beautiful surroundings of Roma. We recommend staying at this hotel, but you need to be ok with the compactness of rooms and limited space the hotel has for areas like its reception and its breakfast room. Saying that we saw happy staff around us and most sights we wanted to see were within a walking distance, so enjoy your stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Paporotnik
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect for shopping as well as for tourism. The staff is very nice and helpful. The mines is that the rooms are small, at least the one we have had (a regular room) was so. but however it was new, clean and I would definitely recommend this hotel for not a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the value ... it was beyond outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: RockyConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Maurcio, Fabio ... la familia ... I apologize for not listing everyone's name! There was nothing they would not do to help us. They made staying at Hotel Forte one of the best aspects of our visit to Roma! The location was central to everything ... close to the train yet sufficiently distant from the hustle of the Spanish steps, in a quaint street, in the middle of shopping with easy access to the piazzas of Trevi, Navona, Pantheon, great restaurants. Extremely comfortable accommodations (we were three), great hot shower, thick towels, beautifully made beds, a flat screen television that worked, spotlessly clean, clean, clean! Closet space is limited, but we were there for four days, so we kept most of our things in the suitcase, and ironed the clothes as necessary - they provided the iron and board. The hair dryer in the bathroom is different so you may want to bring your own. The food in the morning was just the right amount with enough variety served by a humming, happy Teresa. A great place to come back to after a long day of walking and taking trains. If you're looking for a small, traditional, Italian hotel with the wrought-iron elevator in a perfect location at a reasonable cost ... Hotel Forte is for you. If we are ever in Roma, we will be back! In the meantime, we are telling all our friends about Hotel Forte!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet yet minutes away from everything"”
Reviews.Author: Whenareweleaving1012
Reviews.Content: We much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Forte. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small, but clean, modern and comfortable. The AC worked very well. It's only a five minute walk the Spagna subway stop or bus line which get you everywhere you need to go quickly. The street is quaint and quiet. It's on edge of a very nice shopping district; It focuses on quality clothes, jewelry and art, not tourist kitsch, so if you like shopping, you'll be happy. Our only complaint would be the breakfast. It was adequate, but none of the items on the buffet table were particularly delectable. We read that breakfast for the Romans is usually just a coffee and a croissant so maybe they don't put much emphasis on the hotel breakfast. Additionally, we had also just come from Innsbruck where our breakfast buffet was superb (Hotel Wiesses Kreuz).

Reviews.Title: “Situated in charming & peaceful Via Margutta, just a short distance from Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Europeanculturelover
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff in this small hotel situated in a picturesque part of Rome. The rooms are very small, but, hey, you only really need it for sleeping and washing (nice bathroom). Not a full-service hotel in the international sense of the word, in that there is no ground floor presence - you ring a bell to gain access - and then either use the stairs or the old fashioned lift. The small breakfast room offers a good buffet - there are no other public areas, other than reception, but plenty of restaurants round about. Hotel well situated for Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese (ca 30 minutes walk), Trevi Fountain - I'm not particularly athletic, but I walked wherever we wanted to go (this side of the Tiber on this visit) including the Pantheon and Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: GahannaTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forte was located on a very quite street and was close to many sites and transportation. The hotel's staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The bathroom was a little small, but was clean. I would stay at Hotel Forte again and would also recommend Hotel Forte to friends traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: SaxTherapist
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel, safe location, friendly staff. A little pricey for a small room although the location made the cost palatable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jrbrumm
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Forte and will come back if we ever get to Rome again. It is at an excellent location, just a few blocks from the Spanish Steps, and shopping and restaurants all around it. The staff was so friendly and the breakfast was good. We had one room for our family of 4 that worked well for us. Thank you so much for the lovely visit! Janeen Brumm

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel on 1st floor of quiet street.”
Reviews.Author: CiaranHughes
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel on 1st floor of quiet street. The location - Via Margutta - is excellent, on a quiet street close to the Spanish steps and easily walkable to other areas. The staff were very friendly and helpful with booking, restaurant and taxi arrangements. The only negative point was the coffee machine! not really a problem with such good coffee available in the Roman cafes. Restaurant Edy just off Via Margutta is also highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: RosemarieCTUsa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forte is a great place to stay & the location was perfect. We were on a quiet street near the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain & the Piazza del Popolo. They served a wonderful breakfast each morning & the staff was over the top helpful with anything we needed! We hope to come back for another visit very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: jenniferinclyde
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forte is in a wonderful location - on a quiet street just off the Spanish Steps. My husband and I stayed for a few days in May and found the hotel charming, the breakfast typical of Italian hotels with a nice assortment (although I wish the cappuccino's were hand made as they had been in previous reviews rather than coming out of the push button you pick your drink machine...after day 1 we skipped the coffee at the hotel and headed to a near by "bar" for a real cappuccino before setting off for the day), very helpful front desk staff (who gave us some wonderful dinner recommendations and reservations) and the rooms while tiny, to be nicely appointed with very large, very nice bathrooms. We stayed at another, much more expensive hotel in Rome when we returned for a last couple nights at the end of our stay in Italy and wished we'd come back to Hotel Forte - wonderful location and an excellent value! One traveler tip - at least in the room we stayed in, we don't know where we would have put large suitcases - we had "expanded" rollaboard size suitcases which fit very well in our room and were grateful we hadn't brought bigger bags.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel located in of the most gorgeous street in Rome”
Reviews.Author: amartins023
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited Rome and stayed in Forte Hotel - I'm so glad we chose it! It was perfect for us: a small, but pretty (and very clean) hotel, very well located close to the Spanish Steps, in an adorable street. Breakfast was delicious, the staff super firendly, and our room was just lovely. We totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Forte”
Reviews.Author: moylinney
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed our stay at Hotel Forte , our room was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful . The location is really good for sightseeing as so many places are easily in walking distance , and the hotel is in a quieter and very pretty side street . The nearest metro stop is just around the corner so getting around the public transport system is easy . There are lots of restaurants , cafes and shops nearby , which is really good in the evening if you don't want to go far from the hotel . The staff were very helpful in suggesting good restaurants which added to our enjoyment of the trip . Our en-suite only had a shower which was a bit on the small side , but it did not cause us any difficulty .. Larger persons might have had a problem with that , so its worth checking before hand in the special requests when booking . On the plus side - we had fresh towels every day . yes I would return - I think I have thrown a purse load of coins in the Trevi to make sure I do ..

Reviews.Title: “A good small hotel in very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: janet255068
Reviews.Content: Intimate small hotel in wonderful location 100m from Spanish Steps. Staff very helpful, large bathroom, though slightly smaller room which was a little tight with luggage. Basic breakfast included in price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Very helpful and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieC009
Reviews.Content: This hotel, reasonably priced, offers a great location near the Spanish Steps in central Rome. Other attractions are within walking distance for a reasonably fit person. There are also nice restaurants and shops nearby. The hotel provides a lovely breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: johnBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location; very helpful concierge(s); triple room a plus. Quiet street, a short distance from the bustle of Piazza di Spagna.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Location ideal”
Reviews.Author: SJWLAW
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a perfect location, it was quiet street but close to the sights of Rome. Staff were very helpful. Rooms were small but adequate and very clean. Plenty of choice for breakfast. Would definately recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “WHERE YOU WILL WANT TO STAY IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: DonnaM050
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews will state, location is superb - and they are correct. Access to all sites and the subway is #1 when visiting Rome. All walkable distances to all places. Breakfast - hearty, generous, fantastic espresso, great service Staff - very helpful; will arrange for trips, reservations and always available. This was our first trip to Italy, we couldn't have been better served and will make more repeat trips to Rome and the Hotel Forte will be our hotel of choice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Second time back”
Reviews.Author: dgb6
Reviews.Content: Again enjoyed our stay there. Will stay there again, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleased until one mishap ruined my initial good impression.”
Reviews.Author: micheleantaki
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, the building, the room, small but well-appointed, loaded with old-world charm, the cleanliness of t.he bathroom, the (contemporary) murals on the vaulted ceiling of the lobby, the affability of the receptionist/ concierge. Breakfast is abundant but so so. My chief grievance is the way the hotel handled a serious mishap. Upon embarking on my flight on the following day, I realized that my passport was missing. After searching my handbag, it occurred to me that it might have remained with the hotel receptionist who had requested it when I arrived, along with my credit card. For some reason, he had returned my credit card but forgotten about the passport. I called and was told that a taxi would be sent to the airport to hand me the passport...but at my expense! I thought that was inelegant. The taxi would not arrive early enough for me to board the flight. I had to buy a new ticket and also a hotel room in transit because I had lost the last connecting flight to my destination. I showed my displeasure and the hotel reluctantly agreed to split the cost of the taxi. When the taxi arrived, however, I discovered a last pettiness - the additional surcharge for ordering the taxi, had been charged on me and not split. Too bad! i was about to adopt that hotal for my future trips. Now I won't.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: mykidsdad
Reviews.Content: Situated on a very nice, quiet street just a 2 minute walk from the Spanish Steps, Hotel Forte was a good choice for our brief (2 night) visit to Rome this month. While our room was extremely small, it was clean and fit the bill as we were rarely there (just to sleep). The staff was generally very helpful...arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport...good directions to points of interest, etc. The breakfast was delightful - fresh coffees, juices, fruit, pastries, eggs, meats - each morning!! We received a nice bottle of red wine as a thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, very friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Daragh1978
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for a friends wedding and stayed at Hotel Forte. This is an ideal location in relation to sight seeing ie approx 150m from spanish steps. We found the hotel staff to be extremely friendly & helpful with any requests we had over the few days, ie booking taxis, storing our luggage on the last day. We also were given an early check in as our flight arrived early in Rome which was a big bonus. Daragh & Morvenna

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, friendly staff, very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: btdiego
Reviews.Content: Middle aged couple. We spent four days and found the hotel impeccable, its staff extremely friendly and helpful. The location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: madmortons
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 adults staying for 4 nights in Rome. This hotel has a great location, clean rooms, great daily cleaning service and very helpful staff. Breakfast room is small, and several people had to wait to get a table. Breakfast was good, hot bacon and egg, cereals, fruit juice, pastries,meat and cheese, fruit and yoghurt and toast. We missed fresh bread in the morning, but never went away hungry. Reception staff were very helpful with information about travelling about Rome. The location is in a quiet street just a few minutes walk from the Spanish steps, so location was great and was quiet at night. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: arubatango
Reviews.Content: We had a very small quad room but the price was right and the location was terrific! Very close to the Spanish Steps and the train. The breakfast was good. The staff was very friendly and helped us with directions and gave us sightseeing tips. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but VERY small single room”
Reviews.Author: BagsPacked58
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Forte is on Via Margutta which is a very old and famous street in Rome. It is just around the corner from the Spanish Steps, on a quiet, narrow little street. The street that it is on is very quaint and charming. The hotel itself just covers one floor in a multi-story building. It's small, but nice. I booked a single room and it must've been the smallest room I've ever had! Literally -- there was a single bed pushed up against one wall and there was may 4 feet between it and the other wall. There was one tiny window which was covered in heavy draperies, so the room was really dark. I was only there for one night, so it was okay, but it would've been uncomfortable for more than that. But despite the disappointment in the room size, I really liked this hotel -- mostly because it was small and personal and I loved the little street it was on. Plus, it was convenient to shopping and the sights. There was also a nice little restaurant down the street which I liked. Because this street is off the main drag, the restaurant wasn't croweded with tourists -- it was sort of like a hidden gem. I would definitely stay here again, but next time I would pay a little more and book a double room.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, on a quiet back street, really clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: HocJunior
Reviews.Content: We payed €50 pp.pn, and it was completely worth it. It is a boutique hotel so rooms are small you wouldn't want to spend much time in them, bathroom is big new and shower is powerful. The inclusive breakfast is brilliant as it runs up to 10.30, the breakfast lady is always singing (clearly loves her job!) they serve continental but also scrambled eggs and rashers. The location is perfect, right in the heart of the shopping district, 2 mins to the Spanish steps for the fake buys, 2mins from via del corso for the cheap buys but it is located beside Miu Miu and Tiffany and Co. If you have expensive taste. The metro stop is around the corner to get you to the Vatican or collaseum but if your a keen walker both can be reached by foot in about 30mins. We wern't expecting such good service at such a cheap price but I can't fault this hotel in anyway. Definately a diamond in the rough. Enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “All Around Excellent Experience - Would Definitely Stay there AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: MPC07928
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome and a 5 night stay at the Hotel Forte. The first 2 nights, there were 4 of us - and last 3 nights were just 2 of us from the States. Overall, great value - we found the location hard to beat - I have read all the other reviews and everyone mentions the location as one of the best..I agree 1000%!! SO CONVENIENT!! Metro, restaurants, cafes, shopping, sightseeing all within 2 - 30 minute walk. When we first checked in, a female employee was a bit negative on the city of Rome....my friend and I were a bit taken aback. We never saw her again during our stay. All other staff were awesome - Mauro (Mar-Ro), Fabio, and the overnight gentleman whose name i can't recall and others. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful. Breakfast was more than adequate - not a wide selection, but I especially enjoyed the fresh yogurt. My friend had eggs made to order with bacon almost everyday. Our room was a triple with an added bed to fit the 4 of us and the hotel let us stay in the triple instead of making us move to a twin for our last 3 nights. Room size is typical for any major city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hanalou28
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean, but small hotel near the Spanish Steps. Rooms are small but all you need to sleep/shower in. We only stayed 1 night so we did not get to experience the breakfast that is included in the price. Good value for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: 1luvdsun
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in great location. Staff very accommodating, friendly and helpful. Nice little buffet breakfast. We had end room so it was quiet. Small room but large bathroom. With location, we were near all of our favorite spots and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very quiet spot in the heart of busy turist quarter”
Reviews.Author: mem1607
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean small hotel. Friendly, English speaking staff. The location is perfect - 300 meters from the Spanish Steps in a quiet and hidden away little lane - perfect for those who would like to be close to the center of active life and have a calm and peacful sleeping place. Prices a bit too high. Did not like being charged 5 EUR per day use of the Wi-Fi connection - should be free!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is easy wit Hotel Forte.”
Reviews.Author: Hakan_Senturk
Reviews.Content: We were very glad to stay in Hotel Forte. The Hotel is within a stone's throw from Spanish Steps. Villa Borghese, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Popolla are also close. We walked everywhere from the Hotel in city center. Hotel staff was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: dero99
Reviews.Content: the hotel location is a winner we also enjoid good service from the from desk team and quit room

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: jdjn9
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent four nights here prior to a transatlantic cruise. We loved the area, especially the Via Margutta itself with it's quaint shops and yummy nearby upscale vegetarian restaurant. Front desk employees were helpful and friendly with advice. Breakfast was more than adequate. We had rolls, cheese etc with wonderful espresso every morning and very friendly service. The room was tiny and I would definitely upgrade upon return. We did have a lot of luggage due to our three week trip and luckily my husband and I really like each other because turning around in the room became a contact sport. also, bathroom very adequate but the shower would not allow a very large person to turn around or perhaps even get in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Rome visit.”
Reviews.Author: MsNetsky
Reviews.Content: A clean, fresh, welcoming hotel on an absolutely charming, quiet street just blocks from the Spanish Steps and a metro stop. Helpful, professional staff, small but perfectly adequate rooms with modern baths.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convenient, a little Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Joanshar
Reviews.Content: Short walk to the P. di Spagna (Spainish steps) and the metro. Easy walking to great restaurants, Villa Borgese, and many of the main tourist attractions, Good breakfast and very helpful English speaking staff. Taxi from airport 40 euros flat charge on Rome taxis. They all use satilite navigators so have the hotel address written down for your driver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ACreed
Reviews.Content: hotel staff were very helpful, hotel is within minutes to Spanish steps, rooms were small but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fair but a bit dispointed”
Reviews.Author: MassiveMason
Reviews.Content: It's hard to write a fair review when you have no real frame of reference i.e. Rome hotels but I can state the following with confidence. We were moved out of our largish room after the first of three nights to a smaller one to make way for a party of 4. We were told this was for refurbishment. The rooms are dark and badly decorated (Bradford City FC coloured strips) but not untidy or dirty. (you don't go to Rome for the rooms though) All the TV channels were pay only, again you shouldn't really have time to watch TV. I've stayed in many other European capital city hotels and this one was the worst continental breakfast I've ever had. I'll but it to you this way, the cheese selection was Kraft cheese slices and Dairylee Triangles. No i'm not kidding, the lady who did the breakfast was very nice however. The guy on reception was also very helpful. The location wasn't to bad, 50m from the Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: LeedsStefaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel for two nights, we picked it after reading some good reviews and we were not disappointed. The location is great, very central and also the street is very charming, therefore it helps create a magic atmosphere. The staff at the hotel are very helpful, the room was a good size. Breakfast offered plenty of choice. We will definitely be back here in our next stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem.”
Reviews.Author: RoanokeVa
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel on the second story of a historic building, one or two blocks over the Spanish Square where the Spanish steps are located. It was reasonably priced, very beautiful and had incredibly friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are small, but I suspect that is the norm for Rome. If I get the chance to go to Rome again, I will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kmc1021
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Good rate of 100 euro. The location is ideal. The room was small and the windows looked out onto a grated walk. There was no nice view of the street but that was OK as we were only there one night. We left before breakfast so I can't comment on the food. That night we did walk to the Piazza de Popolo, the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. We ended the night with Gelato from Giolitti and then took the cab back to the hotel. Bed was OK and the bathroom was good. Would stay there again but would like a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION-TINY ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: liorhaifa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday in italy. first 3 nights we stayed in rome at FORTE HOTEL ,near the spanish steps. The location can't be better! The rooms are beautifully decorated, but they are tiny-there was enough space for 1 suitcase but very difficult to find room for the second,The bathroom is 60 c"m wide and about 2 meters long- beautiful and new,a huge beautiful sink which blocked your entrance to the shower. the staff-very polite and helpful but on the last day, when we neede help with the luggage(2 women, the men left early to pick the car) nobody bothered to help, BREAKFAST-was ok on the first day(minimal but still ok,) it got worse on the second day and the worst on the 3rd day. when my friend asked for an additional capuccino, she was told that she would have to pay for it!!!But if you need the room for the night, i recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming; Great Location;”
Reviews.Author: fromHalifaxCanada
Reviews.Content: great location. very close to Piazza di Spagna Metro stop. could walk to all the major Rome attractions except the Vatican. only 2 blocks from Via Corso but on alley (although some nights it did sound like there were scooter races), Charming, elegant, modern tv. nice big bathroom and shower. this was our first hotel in Italy and we were impressed by the breakfast. However, after having stayed at other hotels, I would have to say it was good but not great. the server made cappucinos and espresso to order; there was also "regular" coffee and hot water for tea in thermoses. hard boiled eggs. fabulous apricot jam stuffed croissants and other sweet that varied by the day (cake, cookies); prunes, yogurt, canned fruit salad, couple of cold cereals, juice, cold cuts, some weird processed white cheese that easily unwrapped and yet stuck like glue to your bread or whatever you put it on, the packaged dried bread that Italians seem to require at breakfast; sliced bread. staff were very helpful and spoke English well. grocery store close by spiral staircase up to the hotel (although also small old fashioned elevator)

Reviews.Title: “Close to Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: tripdoc51
Reviews.Content: Adequate hotel close to the Spanish Steps and metro stop. Good central location to see all of Rome. Rooms are very small and the bathrooms were hard to manuever, but we were there to see Rome and didn't spend much time in our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forte will not dissapoint!”
Reviews.Author: SCtravelbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Italy for the first time in early Sept. A friend recommended Hotel Forte to us because we were looking for a nice, clean, and reasonably priced hotel in Rome. This combintation was proving to be difficult to find as we were quickly learning that Rome is VERY expensive. We went to Hotel Forte's Web site, which is very easy to navigate, and found GREAT rates and decided to book our reservation. Hotel Forte is on a side street right near the Spanish Steps and you can't ask for a better location. We arrived around 10:30 a.m. and our room was not yet ready (this did not come as a surprise as check-in is not until later in the afternoon). They checked us in and were more than happy to hold our luggage while we explored Rome. The staff provided a great map, showed us where we were on the map and we were off! Once back at the hotel, we were taken to our room. The room was BEAUTIFUL and IMMACULATE! We had a great view of the little cobblestone side street. The shower and bathroom were spacious and again, very, very clean. Breakfast was excellent - a traditional European style with assorted meats, cheeses, breads and pasteries. Don't pass on the cappucino - it too was excellent! Other reviews cite various issues with noise at the hotel. We didn't experience any problems with noise and could not have asked for a better stay. Other reviews also indicate problems with cancelling/changing/altering reservations. READ the contract agreement folks - it's all pretty simply spelled out in the fine print, the same way it is here in the States. And to that end, please remember, just because policies are one way in the States does not mean they are the same in another country. You're the guest - act accordingly! As for customer service, the staff are friendly, gracious, helpful, and pleasant in every possible way. I would highly recommend Hotel Forte to anyone traveling to Rome. It was a perfect introduction to Italy, and we look forward to our next stay at Hotel Forte!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicaletta
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay right my the Spanish Steps. I arrived early and couldn't get an early check in. The hotel gave me great instructions and directions to the sites I wanted to see for the day. I had a great day touring around and when I got to the room I was exhausted. It was very clean and nice. The staff was a great help the two nights I stayed there. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a more perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: caraellenm
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. It was in the perfect spot for a tourister, walking distance to everything. The staff at the Hotel Forte was so helpful and nice. I was a solo traveler so they made me feel very welcomed and helped me plan all my day trips. The room itself was a bit small but that is common in Europe so I was fine with it...I only slept and showered there. I highly recommend this hotel to any travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: DrWiseguy
Reviews.Content: The location can not be beat. It is close to the Spanish steps and a metro station. We used this hotel to see Rome before our cruise and walked easily to most of the sites or used the metro. The hotel was very quiet and clean. The room was small but we were there to sleep and clean-up. The airconditioning was great as we were there in the heat of the summer and the quiet street could not have been more romantic. I highly recommend this to anyone traveling on a budget, yet likes to stay close to the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: macy78
Reviews.Content: In a fantastic location, quiet and clean. Rooms a little small though if you care too much about that. Lovely breakfast included, the service was very good. Just don't go with the hotels preffered taxi company, they charge extra and dropped us off at the wrong terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Onolee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a cruise out of Rome and stayed for 2 extra nights in Rome before flying home. We stayed at the Forte Hotel and could not have made a better choice. Sure the rooms are small, but it is 2 blocks from the spanish steps in the old part of Rome and all accomodations are small in this area. The breakfast which is free is very good, lots of choice available and no complaints here either. The staff is very friendly and speak english which is most helpful. The hotel is very clean and has all the modern conveniences, like internet, flat screen t.v. and airconditioning. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and good location for first timers to Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelsharks
Reviews.Content: First, if you are traveling to Europe for the first time you need to understand that space is at a premium. Most hotel room are on the small size, however Forte was quite roomy for the price. Second you need to consider location, safety, and budget. With the city of Rome you also need to understand most of your time is spent outside of the hotel and room. There is so much to see and do there! Hotel Forte's location is ideal for the "walkers" and those wanting a location near the subway. You are only about 1 block from the subway station at the Spanish steps. This is great if you plan on doing longer trips. If you are decent shape you can walk to everything in Old Rome. We walked to the Vatacan, Coloseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain, etc. We did take the subway and buses out to the Catacombs. For those into purchasing reasonable art on your trip make sure you are there during the weekend. They close Via Marguta (sp) which is the street which the hotel is on and all the local artist set out their stands and it is open to foot traffic only. We bought a great water color from a local that was fantasic. I also called the hotel direct and found a better rate than was posted on the internet. The hotel also arranged a car to pick us up at the airport. Very nice! They were standing with our names on a sign as we exited the arrival lounge at the airport. No stress or haggling with local taxi scammers! :) Enjoy your trip and see the city! Fantastic and can't wait to return. ts

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about everything else”
Reviews.Author: Ellie06Hampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Forte after we saw photos of their roof top apartment with wonderful views. This is the apartment I booked and paid for, but was not what we got. When we arrived at the hotel and were shown to our room i honestly thought we'd been taken to a cupboard. The receptionist explained that the aprtament I had booked and paid for was no longer part of their hotel as it had been sold. We had received no prior warning, no apology and no refund. So we were stuck in this tiny hot room that I had paid over the odds for. The breakfast is just a joke. You are lucky if you are offered a cup of tea/coffee once during your stay. The halls are so noisy with the cleaners banging the doors shut. Besides that the hotel is in a very convenient location close to the spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and recommended”
Reviews.Author: digitalt
Reviews.Content: Good location, not luxury nor silent, but if you need a good base for exploring Rome you could do a lot worse. The lack of restaurant forces culinary exploration and there is plenty near by. Rooms are designed for sleeping, we didn't hear any noise and I haven't slept as well in years. Not excessively stylish, but practical.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: texhills
Reviews.Content: The best thing going for this hotel is its location in Via Margutta where Felini lived. It’s just a couple of blocks from Piazza di Spagna and the Spanish Steps. Lots of smart shops and good restaurants are in the area. Piazza del Popolo, the Tiber River and the Ara Pacis are a short walk. Some of the attractions a bit further away, but easily reached on foot, are Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The hotel has old-world charm. A grated-door, open-style elevator takes guests to the third floor reception with friendly and helpful English-speaking staff. Our room was at the end of the hallway past the “bar” where the ample continental breakfast, including cappuccino on order, was served. The double room with its armoire, writing table and chair was of adequate size to handle two large bags and two rollaboards, though the space between the wall and the foot of the bed was a bit tight. The mattress on the bed was a bit hard for us. We found the bathroom with tub spotlessly clean and modern. The room was serviced daily to our satisfaction. The noise problems at the hotel have been noted in other reviews. The street noise didn’t bother us so much as that from the hotel activities particularly early in the morning. Conversations at the front desk and the clattering preparations for breakfast reverberated down the tile-floored hallway to wake us much earlier than we would’ve liked. It got us moving for our day’s sightseeing, but we would’ve liked to have had a choice in the matter! For our first trip to Rome we chose this hotel for its location and the good price we on a travel website. We got our money’s worth and overall enjoyed our stay. I recommend the hotel if it can be had at a discount price. For our next trip, we’ll most likely stay elsewhere in central Rome due to the hard bed and the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mbbDallas
Reviews.Content: October 6, 2008 We booked our rooms months in advance. We were traveling with my 80 year old mother and requested 2 separate rooms. One double for single use and a large double for 2 persons. The room for her was extremely small, could not open the suitcase except for on the bed. Our room was also small and a double size bed. Bathrooms were small at best. The furnishings were old and did not look clean. Noise level was not good. They were renovating the floor above the hotel which is located on the first floor of the building. I asked about the room on the website which looked lovely. We were given that room but it was not the same that was in the photo. This room was larger, same furnishings as the other rooms. Downside, it was on the street side, which was noisy all day and most of the night. We had to use ear plug to get any sleep at all. My mother was given our old room as an upgrade as there were no other rooms available. The staff was very friendly and tried hard to make things right. But you can not change that the hotel was misrepresented on their website and travel review websites. I have traveled Europe extensively and am not a very picky person, but I was very disappointed with the reviews I previously read and I have relied on in the past, from this website to make my choices for hotels. I would not recommend this place to anyone who wants an nice, clean, quiet place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Forte Winks - No Chance”
Reviews.Author: BeanCounter46
Reviews.Content: Forte Winks or 40 winks were just about the amount of sleep we got in this hotel. Maybe its because we arrived late in the day, although we booked months previously and gave notice of our 8pm arrival time, but we were given the room backing onto their reception. The room was small and poorly lit, but clean and decorated in mock antique style. The bathroom didn't have a bath but a shower I could just about manage to get into. The sink and the bidet both had more floor space than the shower! On one side of our room we had the breakfast buffet room, on the other the busy street, the reception was on the other side and the quite side backed onto the next guest room. We could hear every buzzer/ phone call/ arrival/ departure in reception, every shop shutter or car in the morning and breakfast preparations and orders. When we arrived on our first night we did not realise that the Hotel Forte had its reception on the first floor so when they eventually buzzed us in, we were left standing in a very old dusty/dirty looking foyer for a good time with no-one about, before we went outside and buzzed up again explaining we were new arrivals – “ahh it’s the 1st floor” we were told. The lift looked out of operation so I carried our bags up. So for three days and nights we enjoyed Rome and endured our hotel until our day of departure. We booked a taxi for the airport over 6 hours before our departure. After waiting 15 minutes past the selected departure time I asked where the taxi was. I overheard enough to understand that it had never been booked in the first place. The hotel did, however manage to secure us with another taxi in 4 minutes. On our departure day we even had to ask at reception for more toilet roll! We stayed in Rome before in 1996, at the Regno in the Via Del Corso, so we thought we knew the standard and area we were booking. The Via del Corso is more central but the Hotel Forte was adjacent to the Spanish steps and therefore close to the Metro. On balance I would opt for the location of the Regno, as there are not to many attractions North of the Hotel Forte, whereas the Regno was in the Middle of everything bar a trip to the Vatican. We paid 540 euro for three nights in October, which wasn’t extortinate but was not good value for money either! I think some of the Residenzia accomodation types look better value for money with modern fixtures & fittings etc.

Reviews.Title: “Living it up at Hotel Forte”
Reviews.Author: wishs4u
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Forte was absolutely fabulous. I contacted the hotel prior to our departure to have them send a car to meet us at the airport. As we walked out of arrivals the hotel car service was there to help with luggage and escort us to the car. Upon arrival at the hotel (which is in the best location you could ask for.....spanish steps, trevi fountain all in walking distance) the staff was there to welcome us (very warm and spoke English well). Our room was small, but for the $$ (240 Euro) it was totally worth it. The hotel is very charming, VERY clean, breakfast enough to keep you going until lunch (cereal, juice, coffee, pastry), and in a central location. The Metro is about 5 min. walk, which we took to Vatican City. I give this a thumbs-up. After staying at several other hotels, which cost more, over the years this was a pleasure. I'm sure you'll enjoy!!!!! Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great front desk staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: psu0904
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Forte in June 2008. We found this place by accident – it was suggested to us by Franco (information guy at the Rome airport). I t was wonderful and what’s more, it has been recently renovated. The staff was mostly amazing especially the front desk folks, who were so helpful 24 hours a day. We (traveled with an old friend) did have issues with the breakfast server who seemed to be selective in her service. We both found that she was more attentive to the Euro-looking folks (we are both black females). We discussed this with the front desk and the server herself (she seemed shocked!). Our last breakfast morning was handled much more professionally. However, the experience with the breakfast server is not enough to ruin the review and the experience at the Hotel Forte. The room was beautiful in the Italian tradition – just simply amazing. The hotel itself is located by the Spanish Steps and we found it to be walking distance to all the sights – Pantheon, Imperial Fort, Colosseum – even the Vatican and St. Peters. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marchhare1
Reviews.Content: we arrived late but only had to press the intercom outside and say who we were and were let in immediately. went up in the ornate wrought iron lift to reception. signed in and taken to room which was more than adequate. 2 beds pushed together to make a really huge bed and good mattress, bathroom good although quite high sides to step into. breakfast was help yourself and good selection of pastries etc. staff friendly and very helpful. location superb as spanish steps & metro within 2 mintues walk. all the designer shops close by! the hotel was putting in new wooden floors whilst we were there, but apart from seeing the materials when we went out in the morning everything was gone by the time we came home.on last day it rained and we went back to hotel after lunch (12.00 check out) to wait in lounge area. no problem with staff who kept our case until we decided to go to airport.i have read other reviews and it seems as though some people were not in the same hotel as us! i can recommend it on our experience and we would go back to this hotel again as it felt a very safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel1010
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone I knew. As soon as we arrived the front desk was extremley helpful with explaining everything and giving us a map of Rome advising us of the best places to eat and drink. The room was very Roman Italian and was a comfortable size although not very big. However, the room that we stayed in (first room, straight down the hall from reception) was exposed to the breakfast service noise in the mornings. Other than this, we had a great experience. Location was fantastic as it is a stone's throw away from the Spanish Steps and all the 'expensive' shops. Breakfast was also very pleasant. Overall, would recommend this hotel to anyone who wished to pay less than €120 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, Loved the Location.”
Reviews.Author: DudditsEngland
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Forte could not have been better, and we loved the hotel's location. It was a very short walk to the spanish steps and the local metro station, and was within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain and the Piaza del Popolo. Our room was spotless and pleasant, and we never found it to be unduly noisy. The hotel breakfast was simple but nice, and the selection was quite good. The staff themselves could not have been more helpful or pleasant throughout our stay, even taking the time to draw suggested routes on our map when we asked for locations and travel advice. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Forte and would almost certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Via Margutta”
Reviews.Author: Cazasue
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hotel Forte for its top location on the beautiful Via Margutta just a couple of blocks from the Spanish Steps. The staff was very friendly and helpful but the room was tiny - I mean TINY...it was clean, the teensy marble bath was clean - but there was barely room to turn around. Unfortunately I would not stay there again because the room, for the price, simply was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Try someplace else”
Reviews.Author: steve414141
Reviews.Content: Location was good, the staff was not helpfull at all, Booked a doble room they gave us a room that a single bed barely fit in. Staff seemed like you were bothering them when you asked them a question

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Affordable I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Tita75
Reviews.Content: My sister booked a room for me and my husband at this hotel for 110 Euros (which was within our budget) on our recent trip to Italy. The hotel part at Hotel Forte was ok, they have apt. style rooms (these aren't as nice) we had to stay at this hotel twice during our stay in Italy, so we got to try both the apt. style and the hotel style rooms. The hotel style rooms were nicely equiped, small, but hey you''re in Europe you can't expect huge spaces and comodities like the in US. I would stay here again if I came to Rome, the rooms were clean, the front desk was friendly and I really liked the fact that the hotel is quiet and that you can get a good night's sleep without the noise that is everywhere else in Rome. The breakfast wasn't great, but they do have great capucciono so at least that's five more Euro's your saving by staying there. Try to avoid the Apt. style room, ours didn't even have a phone in the room which made it hard to communicate with my brothers who where in the same hotel. My parents where staying at the Art Hotel (right next door) much more expensive (240 Euros) and the rooms were super modern and very nice, I really liked this hotel if you can afford it, I really recomend it (the breakfast was incredible here). So if you're on a tight budget you will be ok at the Forte Hotel, our room 140 even had a King Size bed (I thought that was great) given everywhere else in Europe you are lucky if you get a full size for 2 people. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forte Rome ...an real Roman experience”
Reviews.Author: stylematters
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Italy which included Rome, Tuscany and Positano. Traveling in Italy is hard work. In each of these places the driving was ridiculous,the cabs rip you off left and right ,people give the most ridiculous directions and the maps around town are off scale so even traveling on foot is tough. But all that said it was the most glorious and wonderful trip . Every corner had beautiful views and food was spectacular. We did stay in the apartment at Hotel Forte in Rome and all that has been said in another posting is true.
