We had a baby with us so the keys, the stairs (actually 4 flights), the distance was even more of a pain than that posting expressed but to be fair I have some other positive observations. That little apartment was really clean. It had everything you needed, shower,plently of towels , a good refrigerator, clean kitchen area and a great location. You are in the center of the action. Walk out your big old Roman door to a lovely coffee shop and excellent restaurants and the most beautiful window shopping in the world. Granted my 19 year old son carried most our luggage (although the conciegre helped us move it in, no one offfered to help us move out). The price is right, the breakfast was wonderful and all in all it was a good experience...only for the hardy and in a group where you feel safe fumbling with keys on a busy street though !!!! My husband thinks I have been too kind regarding the apartment but honestly I felt like I was in an authentic old world city and I loved it !! The regular rooms at Hotel Forte looked beautiful and the staff is personable ...next time I will get a regular room and enjoy the elevator !!!

Reviews.Title: “Run from Hotel Forte....FAST!”
Reviews.Author: LoriDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: we requested a room to sleep 4ppl, and the hotel booked us in an apartment that was 2 blocks from the hotel...ok, no problem. BUT, when we checked in, we were given a map to get to the apartment, a ring with 6 keys, and 3 of them had to be used to get into different parts of the building housing the apartment, and no one escorted us to make sure we could find it and get in. when we finally found the building, there was no lift, so we had to drag our large bags up 3 flights of stairs and struggle with the keys to figure out the doors. when we got in we had a phone that didn't connect us to the hotel (we found out later it was to let people into the building) and it took us an hour to figure out how to turn the air conditioner on. the next day, after a LONG journey around rome, we got back and there had been no housekeeping services done to the room and no fresh towels. when we walked the three blocks to the actual hotel, they told us that housekeeping in the apartment was every other day. when we returned the next day to the same thing, and walked the three blocks to question the hotel...we were told that housekeeping services were only after we checked out, and we were given additional towels. the only thing that was mentioned whan i made the reservation was that the apartment was a few blocks from the hotel. they never disclosed that there was no lift, no housekeeping etc...and we were very unhappy with the responsiveness to our frustrations. we were staying there for 4 nights and in the end, they reduced our rate by 80 euros total, not even one full nights stay. i work for the intercontinental hotel chain, and have been in the hotel business for 15 years, and this is a hotel i would not recommend to my worst customer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Professional Friently Staff”
Reviews.Author: Stephan2020
Reviews.Content: Hello, I would like to thank Hotel Forte Staff the the wonderful stay, although only for 1 night the people were SUPERB! I had to stay for one night in Rome because my passport was expired and I had to renew it the following day. I went to the consulate of Spain and waitted until 13:30. The staff at the hotel knew my case and called the consulate to make sure I was OK and to let me know I could check-out at any time at no extra cost. When I arrived back to the hotel, they were friendly and very professional. To make the long story short the picked up service did not arrived and the owner/manager called the company and in 5 minutes the shuttle was there. He even offered himself to drive me to the airport so I won't miss my flight. The location is only a few steps from the SPanish Steps and 2 minutes walk to the Popolo Plaza. The best shopping stores are around the corner. A+

Reviews.Title: “Refused to honor a confirmed reservation”
Reviews.Author: deranieri
Reviews.Content: In November 2006, I reserved a room with Hotel Forte for a 1-day stay in May 2007, confirmed with a credit card. In March, 2007, I RECONFIRMED the reservation. Upon arrival, I was told that there had been a "problem" with reservations -- which the individual at the desk would not define -- and the hotel would not honor my confirmed reservation. Instead, it shunted me off to another hotel. The desk clerk was indifferent and her "apology" was rote and insincere. I strongly recommend against this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL FORTE WAS FINE”
Reviews.Author: jugadorone
Reviews.Content: HOTEL FORTE was in a good spot , right by the spagna metro station. and the spanish steps. the room was a little small but high quality, the staff was great and very helpful. I would stay there again if i ever went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: PatrizioDublin
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned having spent 5 wonderful nights at the Hotel Forte. This is a beautiful and elegant hotel situated a stone's throw from the Spanish Steps. The location is excellent, situated on a lovely elegant street lined with art galleries and antique shops. There are plenty of lovely restaurants nearby and the street is very quiet at night. We found the hotel room to be lovely, clean and comfortable with a flat screen TV, telephone, safe, hairdryer in the bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The room was very nicely decorated as are the corridors. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast consisted of croissants, rolls, parma ham, cheese and different coffees and teas. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel in a fantastic location and at a very good price for a 3 star in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unproffessional and way overpriced!! Find another hotel! ”
Reviews.Author: tak33
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this hotel has ruined the memory of our whole vacation in Rome. The dealings with the hotel reservation manager since have been frustrating and unprofessional. We were unexpectedly charged an additional 93.00 euro per night to have a cot put in our already cramped "triple suite" so that we could have our kids stay in the room with us. We had reserved two rooms, but asked to have them near each other via the web reservation. When we found out they would be on separate floors, we tried for weeks to contact the hotel via the email address listed to put us in the same room- but no response. We finally got the change made when we finally contacted the hotel (unpublished email) about our flight delay of one day. Not only were we charged the exorbitant 30% increase for the additional child in our room, but we were charged for two days when there wasn't even the extra person (the day we didn't use the room due to flight delay and the day we paid for a second room on the same floor just to have a little breathing room!) The hotel manager finally agreed, after many emails back and forth, to reimburse us for the extreme charges, but then stopped communication and we have not heard back since, nor been reimbursed any amount. Very unprofessional and very overpriced for the type of hotel. It seems like they are trying to make money off tourists however they can!!! Experiences like this make you not want to visit Rome again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: athasofia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Forte during the Christmas holidays. Location is great, just two minutes from Piazza di Spagna. The rooms were good, clean and tidy, but a bit small, like all hotels in Italy. The breakfast was a bit poor, they said it was due to Christmas holidays but that was not a good excuse. They had to be prepared. The staff was very helpful, gave us some advise on what to see and where to go. Probably not worth the regular price(we took benefit of a Christmas offer and payed 75 euros per night for a double room) but if you have no problem with money, the hotel is a good place to stay if first time in Rome and want to see everything.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: EC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Forte before because of its great location but I doubt we'll stay there again. The rooms are average for the price range but are extremely noisy from both inside and outside conditions. The worst offenders were other American tourists (yes, we are too) banging on doors in the late evening. The staff could do more to quiet the situation but didn't. Ask for a courtyard room.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location”
Reviews.Author: Macwebb
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were greeted by front desk staff with friendliness and warmth. Upon checkin, we were shown to a TINY room outside of the lift on the first floor that was virtually impossible to move in, let alone accommodate three pieces of luggage. When we expressed our dissatisfaction , we were shown to a slightly larger, 'hostel' like granny-flat on the 2nd floor. As there were no other rooms available, we had no option but to spend the first night in this noisy, ridiculously cramped room; where it was impossible to sleep. Instead of waking refreshed, energised and ready to explore, we were sleep-deprived and annoyed. It is a shame that it was necessary to express hostility and aggrevation the next morning, to finally be offered a room of standard 'hotel' quality . After our initial unpleasant introduction to the hotel, our stay improved greatly and it was an enjoyable experience. The location is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hreed973
Reviews.Content: I used Venere.com to book the hotel. The hotel location was great and just slightly off the beaten path. They had a great breakfast bar and served the best coffee we ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Elainedavies
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome over the bank holiday and booked the hotel from previous reviews on trip advisor. How glad we were. The hotel was fantastic. It was only small, but very clean and superbly located right next to the spanish steps. We had a room overlooking the cobbled streets and we didnt have any problems with noise at all. The air conditioning worked fine and the plasma tvs worked fine. Breakfast was self service and was sufficient (included cereals, bread rolls, croissants etc), coffee and tea. The hotel offered a taxi service from the airport at a reasonable price which we took advantage of. (for peace of mind really) To sum up, I would recommend this hotel if you want a centrally located, clean hotel at a good price. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “unfair bad press”
Reviews.Author: Gert123
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at the Forte and cannot complain about a single thing. We paid a budget price for the flights and budget price for the room. This hotel is in a fabulous location just a minute's walk from the Spanish Steps and down a cobbled street at the back of all the designer shops. We found the room an average European size (I have stayed in smaller in London!) and spotlessly clean. Yes, so the bathroom was a little cramped and I have stayed in more luxurious rooms, but for the price we paid and the location you couldn't fault it. All but one of the reception staff were very helpful and we had no complaints about the breakfast either. A typical continental style breakfast, but no complaints were made by the staff at how many croissants we ate and cups of coffee and juice we drank! All in all, if you want to stay somewhere out of this world (and pay prices to match) go elsewhere. If you want to see Rome comfortably and on a budget you won't go far wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming Staff hinders my stay”
Reviews.Author: ringlady
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 has just returned from a 3 week stay in Italy / France. Rome was our first stop where we stayed at Hotel Forte based on Trip Advisor reviews. After comparing all the hotels during our stay, our first impression is correct. The hotel's location is conveniently located near Spanish Steps with the Metro right there. The neighborhood feels safe and clean. Another reviewer wrote there are few restaurants around, and that is true. There is a supermarket around the corner which is so convenient. The rooms are smaller than small, most of Europe is small, so that isn't a big deal. Not spic and span clean but passable. But inspite of the convenience I will not return there. The hotel is so unwelcoming. The front desk was so unwilling to help. We felt we were doing them a favor by staying at the hotel. One of the front desk people extended a little help with email and was reprimanded by the boss. Call it petty on my part, but small things like where is the internet place, and where is this plaza, etc, are not out of the ordinary questions for tourists. Thankfully, we found the rest of our hotels to be more welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we expected to be shown to a decent room. However, the reception man advised us that a bathroom was broken in one of the rooms and that they were moving us to an apartment upstairs for the 1st night, for a cheaper rate. When I pushed to see the borken bathroom, there was none, they had simply over booked the hotel and we were being moved despite having booked 5 months in advance! The apartment we were given was smaller then the standard rooms, dingy and out right horrible. So below our expectations, they agreed quickly to even a lower price again. Five minutes into our room, the power went out - granted not the hotels fault, as the whole street was out, but when we returned to the hotel, we had to stumble up the stairs in darkness, as they could not have the brains to place candles or meet you at the bottom with a torch. We had a terrible night, as we struggled to place the key in the door and the window was so thin, even the singing from another building was coming through and the only source of light we had was that omitted from our mobile phones. We complained again about the apartment and again was offered a lower rate - we still paid way to much at 120 Euros though. The next day we were given the room we had booked. The cleanliness was below standard and the breakfast...well, you may as well not bother. The only thing going for this hotel is its location - but why chose it when there are plenty of others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: strawberry05
Reviews.Content: A comfortable base for exploring the bustling city of Rome. Proximity to Spanish Steps and metro station is a plus. Not big or light, but very clean, comfortable and decent. If you do want quiet, don't get a room facing the street, which gets traffic noise in the AM. Oddest thing was that the room phones were continuously discharged, becuase electricity is cut to the room when you leave with the room key. The frustrating thing was that person at the front desk at night had no clue about the cause or solution. The cappucino and homemade yogurt are excellent in the morning! The reviews here were not wrong; it's a good find in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “eh, not too great”
Reviews.Author: nunununu
Reviews.Content: I did not have a fabulous experience at Hotel Forte. In comparison with other three star hotels in Rome, this one is lacking. It is basically clean, but not spotlessly clean, which is something I would expect even at some two star hotels that I have been to in Italy. The mattress in my room was horrendously uncomfortable. Thank goodness for the feather bed which I slept on top of because I was seriously concerned that the spring might bust through the mattress. There was an unspoken battle with the maid concerning my only blanket. After my first night, it was taken away, rolled up into a ball and thrown atop the armoire. On my second night, it was in my armoire, on top of all of my clothing which had fallen off the hangers. Horrible. The in-room safe was barely big enough to hold a camera let alone my tiny little laptop (12”). Besides the bad bed, the battle with the maid, and the tiny safe, there was the typical Italian hotel experience of having to place your key into a receptacle in order to have electricity. This I can understand as electricity is not cheap in Italy. Mine, however, loudly buzzed all night long, so I was forced to take it out of the wall. The next day, all of my electronic equipment was uncharged, and I had to fumble around in my dark room (yes, in day time because the window was so tiny) in order to turn on the light. There was also a smoke detector that flashed lights all night long that was right above the bed. Very distracting for this light sleeper. On that note, the walls are rather thin as well. In regards to service… On my first night, I had a bottle of water from the minibar. It was never replaced throughout the week even though I asked repeatedly. The breakfast attendant was fairly rude as she slapped down my hot drink order on the table spilling half of the hot water on the table. The breakfast itself is among the worst I have seen in all of Italy. There was no fresh fruit, and there was only a bit of curdled yoghurt, stale corn flakes and some slimy looking meat and boiled eggs that smelled a little strange. This was at the beginning of the breakfast service. The front desk staff, though, was polite, although I never really asked much of them besides checking me in, wake up calls, and for a taxi at checkout. My direct dial phone in my room never really worked, and I was never able to successfully dial out. People who called in to me were never able to get through to the room. So much for my business trip. There is wireless access though, which was nice. The location is great though. Via Marguta is a wonderful spot, so close to everything by foot or it is right between two metro stops on the A line if you are not a big walker. It was a little too expensive for the service (or lack thereof) that was received. Next time, I will spend a little more and stay in some of the nicer hotels in the area of which there are many.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Cute, clean room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kmragrl
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at Hotel Forte in Rome for two nights at the end of our 10 day vacation in Italy. We really liked the location (just a block from Spanish Steps and the Metro) in an area that reminded me of Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills. Our room had clean comfortable beds. We found it a little hard to move in because we had a twin bed put in the room for our 4-year-old son but none-the-less a nice room with plenty of space in the bathroom. The shower was easy to get into and there was plenty of hot water. The complementary breakfast was good--pastries, fruit, cereals, cheese, biscotti, coffees, juices and milk. And there was no problem taking a few extras with me to bring back to the room or to take on the go as we toured the city. The staff was very helpful and friendly. On our last day they arranged for a driver to pick us up at 5 am and they gave us coffee and croissants even though the breakfast room didn't open until 7 am. We couldn't be happier with this hotel, staff and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Hotel Forte”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days (Nov. 7th-11th 2005) and it was pleasant. Location is perfect; its not more then a 2 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and its on a quiet street so outside noise was at a minimum. The room was clean and comfortable, albeit a little on the small side--but probably not any smaller then most of the hotels in Rome (or Europe for that matter). Hotel noise, i.e., other guestrooms, elevators, etc., were apparent, but they did not keep me up late at night or early in the morning. I had one issue: my plane was redirected from Ciampino to Fiumincini so I did not get the car service that they arranged. When I arrived at the hotel via public transportation, they asked me to pay for the cab that was apparently still waiting for me at Ciampino (3 hours later). We ended up coming to a mutually agreeable solution, but I didn't like having to "negotiate" on the day of my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding a reasonably priced hotel for three in central area of Rome - based on the reviews we saw here, we booked the Hotel Forte. The location was terrifice - just a block from the Spanish Steps. From that location, we were able to walk everywhere and the Metro was just a block away also. The staff was very helpful and accomodating, the breakfast was good - had more than just a roll. Our room was very quiet at night. We were checking out before breakfast and the front desk person went back to the kitchen and got us a couple of rolls and orange juice to take back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this quaint, clean and friendly hotel on a quiet street just 2 very short corners off the main Via Condotti shopping boulevard in Rome, very near the Spanish Steps. The lobby staff was very professional and friendly and the room we had was typical in Rome, small, high ceilings, armoir, but very well-appointed and a large, very clean bathroom with tall shutter-windows for a fresh breeze. I was very sick with a cold and couldn't accompany my husband the first day, who was meeting our son and his buddy nearby at the Spanish Steps. They had been backpacking throughout Europe, so I stayed at the hotel. The staff was so kind, they fixed hot tea and honey for me and turned the TV in the breakfast room to face me as I slumped in the corner of the clean and bistro-like room. I can't say enough about what a nice place this is--hard to beat for both location/value/cleanliness and of course, the excellent staff. I read the reviews on Trip Advisor before reserving, and was I glad I did! I highly recommend Hotel Forte and will definitely stay here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxineKitty
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Forte. The people at the front desk helped us out anyway they could. The beds were comfortable. The continental breakfast served in the morning was very good. The street was one block off a main road. Because there was basically no cars driving down the road Hotel Forte is on, it is extremely quiet. You are within walking distance to good restaurants and the Spanish Steps. Only one problem we encountered that had to do with the showers. That is why I'm giving it "Above average" instead of "Excellent". We could barely make it into the shower, because the sliding doors were very narrow. If I bent over, my rear would turn off the water or turn it from hot to cold. If we have the chance to return to Rome again, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forte a treasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really good place to stay, my husband and I booked a double room for E.110,00 and it was just marvellous, large bathroom with a tub at last a great accomodation for a cheap value considering the prices in the others Roman's hotels. Breakfast in the morning was a great experience everything was served by a gentle lady but please in other sites I saw many guest who were disappointed with the lady behaviour at the closing time. She is working and at this time she have to finish you are in vacation but the respect for other's job have to exist..The reception was lovely, helpful Manuel Manuella the two front desk were so kind and everything for them were so important to do of our stay was a beautiful one, they add at our stay a smile...The others receptionists were great. The location was superb.We will definitively stay again at Hotel Forte.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at Hotel Forte”
Reviews.Author: CLJBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay at the Hotel Forte on the Via Margutta. Via Margutta is a quiet sidestreet, with art galleries and antique shops, close to the Spanish Steps. The hotel staff were very pleasant and acommodating, they reserved for car service from the airport, a pleasant amenity for jet-lagged travelers. I recommend the Hotel Forte highly.

Reviews.Title: “great if you're a bat...”
Reviews.Author: bellavista_8
Reviews.Content: For us it was the only room left and we paid a reduced rate of 120 euros a night which I guess for the position of hotel wasn't bad - lovely quiet road - We had room 144 - a triple room - weird split level room with bathroom and 'child area' being on the ground floor - REALLY dark with low ceilings and a distinct whiff of drains - minature bath with seat that you showered in (ceiling too low to stand up) and nowhere to clip your shower head onto so nightmare reaching for the shampoo bottle. Windows looked out onto a beautiful view of... a brick wall. Could hear lift shaft and people talking in other rooms - fine if its just a place to sleep that you're after.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel Forte”
Reviews.Author: Doreen973
Reviews.Content: And there was Three of us! Three Flight Attendant Friends on Vacation. When we arrived at the Rome airport we really didn't know where we were going to stay. All we knew is that we needed a triple room near the spanish steps. We went to the Hotel desk. A nice man helped us pick the Hotel Forte. It cost is 120 Euro's for a triple room with a shower/tub. The taxie ride from the airport to the hotel was 39 Euros. On the way back to the airport it was 60 Euros. When we arrived at Hotel Forte we were greeted by a nice young man. We looked at our room first before we decided to stay there. It was nice, clean and comfortable for the 3 of us. We had a bathroom that had a tub/shower. Not just a shower so if you want a shower let them know ahead of time. This tub/shower didn't have a curtain so you had to sit in the tub and take the shower nozel off and wand yourself. It was different because americans are used to showers! The blowdryer was weak so bring your own if you need some power. There is a safe for your belongings and a small tv with not much on it. The Beds were nice and I slept well. The Hotel was so very QUIET. It was great for sleeping! You could hear a pin drop! If you want to use the telephone to call out long distance do not use the "You can use your credit card" to call card next to the phone. These charges are outrages! My friend called the USA and it cost her $55.00 american dollars for 20 minutes! " Be careful " The free breakfast was nice. Cappacinno was great, the danishes, and the service. THe OJ tasted like Tang, but no big deal. If you want a Coca Cola they have some but it will cost you 2 euros each ( Just to let you know) I would reccomned this hotel for you if all you want to do is sleep and be confortable. We mainly wanted a nice clean place. We were always on the go and barely in the hotel. This hotel is in a wonderful location near the spanish steps, shopping, resturants, and banks ( if you need an atm withdraw) Everything is in walking distance it this hotel is in a safe location. Enjoy your stay! We did and we will be back again someday!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: compagnoned
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were assigned room 110 - tiny room with a microscopic bathroom. Wc was mounted too close to the bathtub and it was kind of hard to use it. The queen size bed was short. If you're more than 5'2", well, you won't fit in it! ...but the worse has yet to come... Room 110 was located behind the reception area and next to the breakfast room...so...this kept us awake for the entire night! It was impossible to sleep!!! Loud conversations from the reception area (+ the reception phone rang millions of times) and loud noises from the breakfast room (starting @ 5.45am) ruined our stay. Our discomfort was reported 3 times to Claudio (the guy at the reception - very rude and unprofessional), but he couldn't care less. He answered that the hotel was fully booked and that he couldn't have done anything about it. He also added that our complaint was kind of odd because, in 2 years, we were the only guests reporting this problem. When we have insisted saying that this treatment was not acceptable (the room was paid €130.00/low season), he laughed at us saying: "Ma'm, what you want me to do? Stay on my knees and apologize?". So, we've asked to talk to the Hotel Manager, but he found a bunch of excuses and didn't help us. After all this happened, we decided to have our breakfast and leave immediately after it. Breakfast room was ridicolous! 4 tables for 16 rooms. We waited for 20 minutes before being served ... and by the time a table became available, all the assortment of pastries and cookies was gone and never replenished. When we checked out, no discount was offered. Bottom Line: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY @ FORTE!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and dishonest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In keeping with previous recent reviews, we had a confirmed booking for nearly 2 months when we attempted to stay there in November 2004. On arrival, after a long day's travel, we were told a story about our room not being available because someone had got sick and their booking having to be extended. We were sent off to another hotel (the Terminal) in another area to which we wanted to stay but with a promise that arrangements had been made for us to stay at the same rate. The hotel was fine but upon checking out, the bill was considerably more than the price we had agreed to pay for the Hotel Forte. I refused to pay the extra charge, and after much argument in a busy hotel foyer, the original price contracted for the Hotel Forte was accepted. The Hotel Forte is a dishonourable establishment which clearly has no scruples, nor regard for its clients. I strongly recommend that you look for other accommodation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and Rude!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had my travel agent book a room at Hotel Forte for November for myself my husband and 6 year old. When we got to the Hotel the extremly rude man at the front desk said that it didn't matter if I had a confirmation number they overbooked and there was nothing he could do. Even though I had a guarentee of a room with 3 double beds he just laughed at me and said sorry, and turned to an Italian speaking customer while we just stood there after traveling all day. Anyway, after a lot of arguing and tears from my 6year old because she was tired and wanted to sleep the man at the front desk called the Hotel Del Corsa who on the next street over. So glad this happened the Hotel Del Corsa was ten times nicer and cleaner we had a mini suite overlooking a great street two bedrooms a jacouzi tub and it cost 10 euro less than Hotel Forte. The Hotel Del Corsa was even nice engough to hold our bags the next day after we checked out and called a private driver to take us to the airport. So my advise stay away from the Hotel Forte....go to the Hotel Del Corsa.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents immensely poor value for money. I booked a double room for 4 nights in November at Euro 125 per night. On arrival I was told that there was a plumbing problem and that the first night would have to be spent in a sister hotel upstairs (Manfredi). This was terribly inconveniencing as we couldnt really settle in knowing we had to move. To my great horror, i heard from other guests the following moring that they were in the same detriment because Forte had been overbooked. I have seen from other reviews that the hotel seem to overbooking far too readily. The noise levels in the rooms are appalling. Sounds from neighbouring rooms are easily audible through the paper thin walls - including shutting of doors, TV, conversations and ALL bathroom noises. We had roudy neighbours on one of our nights there and we could barely get any sleep. Our room had NO view. Breakfast is very basic; water for tea is never boiling and milk has to be requested a hundred times. When things are finished, well tough. There are only four tables and so you have to queue if you arrive later. Breakfast items themselves were basic and not necessarily fresh. Orange juice was diluted down squash! Most irritating of all were the three arrogant gentlemen who man the reception desk -completely unhelpful, oblivious to the needs of their guests and at times, down right rude. My advice is - DONT WASTE your money or your holiday at this hotel. There are plenty more hotels in Rome. The spanish steps location isnt THAT amazing given that everything is walking distance anyways, and taxi rides compared to the UK are very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Welcome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back after spending a week in Rome (4th to 11 November). Staff friendly and helpful, rooms on the small(ish) side, although very clean and tidy. Breakfast lovely, although you might have to wait for a table as there are only 4 tables available at any one time and around 20 rooms in the hotel. Intercom is working, air conditioning is centraly controlled and is now off for the low season, bit of a pain for the first couple of days for our stay as Rome was enjoying a bit of a heatwave. Location is excellent, very close to the Spanish Steps and all the main attractions are within walking distance. I would reccommend this hotel and the staff. Other pieceS of useful information - Bar in the Hard Rock cafe has a happy hour from 5 til 8pm, two drinks for the price of one, make good use of it. Beware of getting ripped off by taxi drivers, we were charged 40 euros to go from Termini Station to the hotel. Travelled by Ryanair, never again, most unpleasant experience, left standing at Stanstead Aairport for an hour waiting for our bags!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Beware of the intercom!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Forte iis ideally located, the rooms are clean and well appointed (although they are a bit on the small side!) We found the staff to be welcoming and helpful. However, the external intercom was broken meaning we would have to 'buzz' the upstairs hotel to gain access, and the staff at Forte did not seem to be remotely concerned by this. Overall, this is a lovely hotel in a great location - would reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Double booked and unconcerned”
Reviews.Author: SCS
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a month in advance after reading the great reviews, planning to stay for 4 nights. We arrrived at approx 9pm, to be told via the hotel intercom that we were not to go to the Forte reception as they had no rooms remaining -despite the fact that we had a confirmed booking. They had arranged a room in an adjoining hotel, who would accommodate us for one night and then we were to come back to forte. We went to the Forte reception to try and sort out the confusion and to provide our confirmed reservation. The receptionist was very offhand, telling us that it was common practice to overbook and that sometimes it's someone else who it happens to, and sometimes it's you who is unlucky! He then told us to go to the other hotel as there was nothing more he could do and he walked away!!! The room in the other hotel (the Manfredi) was tiny - in other hotels it would have been classified as a single rather than a double. However the staff there were very helpful and we asked if we could stay on rather than go back to the Forte. I've since read from reviews on other sites that others with confirmed bookings had been turned away. I'd therefore not recommend this hotel as you do not know where you'll end up staying!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Forte
